summary: The "No Tax Breaks for Union Busting (NTBUB) Act" aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code to deny tax deductions for employer spending intended to influence employees regarding labor organizations and activities. This includes expenses related to unfair labor practices, meetings discussing labor organization, and certain reporting requirements. The bill defines labor organizations and activities, and mandates information reporting, including penalties for non-compliance. It also includes special rules and exceptions, and prescribes regulatory authority for the Secretary.
